tit.e: Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Hokkeji Town, Nara City)
tit.cmt: 用語を変え、補足しました。
tit.e: Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Hokkeji Town, Nara City)

sen.j: ウワナベ古墳とは奈良市の平城宮跡北方、法華寺町に存在する前方後円墳。
sen.e: Uwanabe Kofun (ancient tomb) is a zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) located in Hokkeji-cho, north of Heijo Palace Site in Nara City.
Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound located in Hokkeji Town, north of Heijo-kyu Palace Site in Nara City.
Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound located in Hokkeji Town, north of Heijo-kyu Palace Site in Nara City.

sen.j: 宇和奈邊古墳とも綴られる。
sen.e: "ウワナベ古墳" is also written as "宇和奈邊古墳".
Uwanabe-kofun (ウワナベ古墳) Tumulus is also written as "宇和奈邊古墳" in Chinese characters.
Uwanabe-kofun (ウワナベ古墳) Tumulus is also written as "宇和奈邊古墳" in Chinese characters.

sen.j: 付近に存在する大小60あまりの古墳集団である佐紀盾列古墳群（ウワナベ古墳群）の東端に位置している。
sen.e: It is located in the east end of the Sakitatemani Kofun Group (Uwanabe Kofun Group) consisting of just over 50 large or small kofun in the vicinity.
It is located in the east end of the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster (Uwanabe-kofun Tumuli Cluster) consisting of just over 60 large or small tumulus in the vicinity.
sen.cmt: 数値を修正し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: It is located in the east end of the Sakitatenami-kofun Tumuli Cluster (Uwanabe-kofun Tumuli Cluster) consisting of just over 60 large or small tumulus in the vicinity.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 明治時代には英国出身の大阪造幣局 (日本)技師で登山家でもあるウィリアム・ゴーランドによって調査が行われた。
sen.e: In the Meiji period investigation was made by William Gowland, who was British, an engineer in Osaka Mint Bureau and also a mountaineer.
In the Meiji period investigation was made by William Gowland, who was a British engineer in Osaka Mint Bureau and also a mountaineer.
In the Meiji period investigation was made by William Gowland, who was a British engineer in Osaka Mint Bureau and also a mountaineer.

sen.j: 英国への帰国後1897年に発表された論文「The Dolmens and Mounds in Japan」の対象となった古墳（名称は記されていない）は現在ウワナベ古墳であると比定されている。
sen.e: After returning to the U.K., he published a monograph, "The Dolmens and Mounds in Japan", in which he referred to a certain kofun (whose name was not mentioned), but now the kofun he mentioned has been identified as the Uwanabe Kofu.

After returning to the United Kingdom in 1897, he published a monograph, 'The Dolmens and Mounds in Japan,' in which he referred to a certain tumulus (of which the name was not mentioned), but now the tumulus he mentioned has been analogically considered as the Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「1897年に」を補足し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: After returning to the United Kingdom in 1897, he published a monograph, 'The Dolmens and Mounds in Japan,' in which he referred to a certain tumulus (of which the name was not mentioned), but now the tumulus he mentioned has been analogically considered as the Uwanabe-kofun Tumulus.
